description.narrative: The project is to provide support towards contributing to balanced, sustainable growth and reduction of urban poverty in Bangladesh. NUPRP will work nationwide and cover up to 4 million poor people living in cities and towns in Bangladesh.

activity-description.narrative: Inclusive urban development and poverty reduction

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: Revised indicators for 2020 1.1 Level of engagement by Municipalities and City Corporations for inclusive climate resilient urban development (mahallah and poor settlement mapping, community action planning, city-wide plans and budgets). 1.2 Number of Paurashava with functional decentralized committees (Disaster Management Committee/Town Level Coordination Committee/Ward Committee) with representation from Town Federation/CDC Clusters/CDCs. 1.3 Number of Cities/Towns with Pro Poor and Climate Resilient Urban Strategy under implementation (stage 1: Assessment Reports developed and shared, stage 2: Strategy Developed, and stage 3: Strategy Implemented) 2.1 Percentage of Community Organisations (a) CDCs; (b) CDC Clusters (c) Federations whose performance is judged "fully effective " on an objective and agreed scale to assess institutional effectiveness as a result of capacity building. 2.2 Percentage of CDCs implementing Community Actions Plans (CAP) based on the Guidelines. 2.3 Number of Savings & Credit Group (SCG) members and their effectiveness to address shocks and stresses. 3.1 Percentage of education grantees completing the academic year in which they receive the grant (which contributes to Early Marriage Prevention). 3.2 Number of (a) pregnant and lactating women upto 6 months (b) Children (7-24 months) accessing Nutrition Cash Transfer Grants. 3.3 Number of Safe Community Committees (a subset of CDC Cluster) working with social service providers to address VAWG and early marriage issues. 3.4 Number of people who have utilized (a) Business Development Grant; (b) Skill Building Grant. 4.1 Number of Community Housing Development Funds (CHDF) established as legal entities. 4.2 Number of Households using their CHDF loan (ICF KPI 4) 4.3 Number of Households with climate resilient housing (a) New Housing; (b) Upgraded Housing. 4.4 Number of Cities/Towns with Land Tenure Action Plans implemented (based on Vacant Land Mapping for pro poor housing. 5.1 Number of person

comment.narrative:
1.1: 15 Cities/Municipalities 1.2: 8 Municipalities 1.3: PURS is yet to be developed. Climate Change Vulnerability Assessment (CCVA) completed in 9 cities.
2.1: All assessment processes will be completed by December 2019. Total 2463 CDCs are now functional at city level. 2.2: 14 Town Federations. 2.3: GBP 1.94 million has been generated in 19 cities up to August 2019. Total 175,674 members (F-174,651 and M-1023) participated in savings & credit activities in these 19 cities.
3.1: This indicator is still in progress,this will be measured towards the end of the year as part of the impact evaluation. 3.2: 26,997 pregnant and lactating mother received individual counselling on nutrition issues in 15 cities. 3.3: 100 of Safe Community Committees (SCCs) formed at cluster level in 8 cities 3.4: 14,186 Education Grantees in 15 cities; 8,927 grantees identified for business grants in 15 cities and 5,055 grantees for apprenticeship have been selected with approved contracts across 15 cities 3.5: 470 SCC members were trained on VAWG and early marriage in 4 cities.
4.1: 3 4.2: 248 against the total 2019 target of 300. 4.3 Low cost housing in 2 cities. 4.4 VLM has been piloted in 2 cities
5.1: 59,700 people are able to access safe drinking water and 184,444 people will serve access to sanitation. 5.2 3 9 CCVA with Infrastructure Assessment 5.3 121 SIF contracts, by this reporting period, the programme supported 8691 persons by constructing Footpath, Drain & Drain slab.
